snippet: In a subtle form of competition, Xi Jinping is picking off American allies to join the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank.
abstract: Chinese Pres Xi Jinping is enticing American allies including Britain, Germany and South Korea to join Asian Infrastructure Bank, in low-key competition with United States' pursuit of Trans-Pacific Partnership; many in Obama administration view it as most important geopolitical power struggle in world.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and EDWARD WONG
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Edward Wong from Beijing. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: In a subtle form of competition, Xi Jinping is picking off American allies to join the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank.

headline.main: As Obama Plays China Card on Trade, Chinese Pursue Their Own Deals
headline.print_headline: As Obama Plays China Card on Trade, Chinese Pursue Their Own Deals
